TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1235
TEI.2.document_title: George S. Pentacost to Stephen F. Austin, 11-25-1825

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1235

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Personal business.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Rio San Bernard*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="11-25-1825">25th Novm 1825*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Sir as circumstances prevent me from comeing to *location_mentioned*Town*/location_mentioned* as, I calculated you will be so good as to transmit the money, (if paid over to you from *person_mentioned*Coles*/person_mentioned*) to me by *person_mentioned*Mr. Curtis*/person_mentioned* and relieve me from verry pressing wants indeed and you will vary much oblige.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Geo S. Pentacost*/person_mentioned**/p* *p*P. S. You will please to keep back in your possession the money you loaned me*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Geo. S P*/person_mentioned**/p* *p*[Addressed:] *person_mentioned*Conl. S. F Austin*/person_mentioned*—*location_mentioned*San Felippe de Austin*/location_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
